benchmark_details.name: MineAnyBuild
benchmark_details.overview: MineAnyBuild is a novel benchmark built on the Minecraft game, which aims to evaluate the spatial planning capabilities of open-world AI agents. It consists of 4,000 curated tasks and evaluates dimensions including spatial understanding, spatial reasoning, creativity, and spatial commonsense.
benchmark_details.data_type: executable spatial plans and visual question-answer pairs

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark the spatial planning evaluation for open-world AI agents in the Minecraft game, enhancing the research in spatial intelligence.

data.source: Curated from various player-generated content on the Internet, including GrabCraft and Minecraft Official Wiki.
data.annotation: Annotated by human reviewers and MLLMs

methodology.calculation: Scores are calculated based on weighted formulas that consider various evaluation dimensions.
methodology.interpretation: The final scores reflect the ability of AI agents to execute spatial planning and reasoning in a 3D environment.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance details for several MLLM-based agents provided.
methodology.validation: Tasks were validated through testing against existing MLLM models and various parameters were adjusted to ensure reliability.
